topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Connecting a Network to a Router

body.p: A network connects to the router through an interface. You must create an interface between the network and router to remotely connect to the network and any instances on that network through the router.
When you create a new router, the router is not associated to any subnet. You can optionally connect the router to an internal network.

section.title: Connect a network to the router

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.

Based on whether you are working on a project or the domain:
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Routers tab.
Click the Project dashboard, then the Network panel, then the Routers tab.
The available router(s) appear.
Click the name of the router you want to connect to the network.
On the Router Details tab, click Add interface.

On the Add Interface screen:
Select a subnet associated with the network you want to connect with from the Select list.
Optionally, specify an IP address for the interface that is in the IP range.

Click Add Interface
The network is connected to the router.
